metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7798 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The openssl gem for Ruby uses the same initialization vector (IV) in GCM Mode (aes-*-gcm) when the IV is set before the key, which makes it easier for context-dependent attackers to bypass the encryption protection mechanism.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7798` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libruby2.3 - 2.3.1-2~16.04.2
ruby2.3 - 2.3.1-2~16.04.2
ruby2.3-tcltk - 2.3.1-2~16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ruby-attr-encrypted: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
ruby-encryptor: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
ruby2.3 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.3.1-2~16.04.2').
